question.body: Using the terms isometric and isotonic contractions explain why this observation is correct.

part.explanation: A concentric isotonic contraction is required to lift a glass. The bicep will shorten as the glass is lifted. Cross-bridges are formed and will be released as you set the glass back down. In order to hold a glass of water at arm’s length for one minute you are using an isometric contraction. You are attempting to maintain stability at your shoulder and elbow joints in a position that is not “resting” for an extended time.
